content: overcoming of metaphysics [Destruction] corresponded to endeavor to first learn to attend to oblivion of Being, to experience this oblivion, absorb this experience into relation of Being to man, preserve (verwahren) it there [ontological difference & Being] > in the need (Not) belonging to oblivion of Being, question: “What is metaphysics?” perhaps most necessary for thought > [Destruction] representational thought relinquished to thinking brought to pass (ereignetes) by Being itself, in thrall to Being (um dem Sein höriges Denken) [MOP, telos]: more thoughtful our thinking becomes, more purely our thinking will stand of its own accord in sole action appropriate to it [attention to Being]

linkedContent: presencing (“being”) always presencing directed toward human essence, presencing as a call (Geheiss) that calls upon human essence > human essence as such is a hearing, belongs to calling of this call, the approach of presencing > that which is the Same (“being”?) each time: belonging together of call & hearing—“What am I saying? It is no longer ‘being’ at all” [beyond Being] > relinquish isolating/separating word “being” just as decisively as name “human being” [can never call human being and being same] [hermeneutic circle leads beyond Being, beyond itself?]

content: by no means easier to say “being” than to speak of the nothing > shows how once more, inevitably, everything depends (ankommt) on correct saying (rechte Sagen), the logos whose essence logic/dialectic of metaphysics can never experience > is it due to “being” (as Same) that our saying fails? all too readily suspected as so-called “mysticism”? > [beyond Being, Derrida] would the crossing of the line leave language of fundamental words to whim of those who are speaking? enough for language to be universally comprehensible? or do other [uniquely unique] laws/measures prevail here [totally other]? (these questions are scarcely beginning to become worthy of question—to feel home in them)

content: overcoming of nihilism only possible when essence of nothing in its former kinship w/ “Being” can arrive (ankommen) and be accommodated (unterkommen) among us mortals [not yet there, telos]
linkedContent: overcoming of nihilism only possible when essence of nothing in its former kinship w/ “Being” can arrive (ankommen) and be accommodated (unterkommen) among us mortals [not yet there, telos]

content: what is the Ort of the nothing? > thinking continually led around/chased around the Same as though a magical circle, w/out ever being able to approach this Same [beyond Being] > “good definition” of nihilism points us toward realm that demands a different saying (anderes Sagen) [totally other?] > if turning belongs to “Being,” so that latter resides (beruht) in former, then “Being” dissolves [auflösen] into the turning [logic of exemplarity] > [the first] X Being, initially to prevent “Being” from being a being that then stands face-to-face w/ human (Being not independent from human being) [Being needs human]

content: like X Being, nothing would also have to be written [differance, writing], thought in same way, human essence belongs to nothing in its thoughtful commemoration, human being essentially participates in nihilism, he himself is this zone & line [re: overcoming nihilism]
linkedContent: like X Being, nothing would also have to be written [differance, writing], thought in same way, human essence belongs to nothing in its thoughtful commemoration, human being essentially participates in nihilism, he himself is this zone & line [re: overcoming nihilism]

content: for Jünger, reduction characteristic of nihilistic trends; for Heidegger, reduction w/in Beings rests in a production of Being: unfolding of will to power into unconditional will to will [using destiny to affirm fuzzy assessments of an epoch] > the disappearance (Schwund) (absence) determined out of/through a presence (Praesenz), such presence precedes/surpasses all that disappears [nihilism & metaphysics as same destiny, Nietzsche]
linkedContent: for Jünger, reduction characteristic of nihilistic trends; for Heidegger, reduction w/in Beings rests in a production of Being: unfolding of will to power into unconditional will to will [using destiny to affirm fuzzy assessments of an epoch] > the disappearance (Schwund) (absence) determined out of/through a presence (Praesenz), such presence precedes/surpasses all that disappears [nihilism & metaphysics as same destiny, Nietzsche]

content: surpassing (Überstieg) is metaphysics itself, not a doctrine, but fact that such surpassing is “given” > given in sense of brought onto path of its prevailing, destined > destiny of (objective genitive [control genitive]) metaphysics: incalculable fullness/suddenness (unberechenbare Fülle und Jähe) of what unfolds as surpassing > acc. this destiny, human representation (Vorstellen) itself becomes metaphysical > the surpassing that returns to beings, “the transcendens pure & simple,” is “the being” of beings
linkedContent: surpassing (Überstieg) is metaphysics itself, not a doctrine, but fact that such surpassing is “given” > given in sense of brought onto path of its prevailing, destined > destiny of (objective genitive [control genitive]) metaphysics: incalculable fullness/suddenness (unberechenbare Fülle und Jähe) of what unfolds as surpassing > acc. this destiny, human representation (Vorstellen) itself becomes metaphysical > the surpassing that returns to beings, “the transcendens pure & simple,” is “the being” of beings

content: essence of nihilism is nothing nihilistic [a thought that palliates disagreeableness of thought of Verwindung of metaphysics] > Ge-stell when withdrawal of Being is represented nihilistically, that which presences as standing reserve (Bëstandigkeit) seems self-sufficient > X Being remains absent in strange way, maintains itself in a concealment that conceals itself [oblivion: a sheltering that preserves]
linkedContent: essence of nihilism is nothing nihilistic [a thought that palliates disagreeableness of thought of Verwindung of metaphysics] > Ge-stell when withdrawal of Being is represented nihilistically, that which presences as standing reserve (Bëstandigkeit) seems self-sufficient > X Being remains absent in strange way, maintains itself in a concealment that conceals itself [oblivion: a sheltering that preserves]

content: people have tended to represent “oblivion of being” as if Being were an umbrella forgotten by some philosophy professor [Nietzsche, cf. S] > oblivion, concealing of as yet unrevealed essence (Wesen) (verbal—essential unfolding) of X Being, shelters (birgt) untapped treasures, promise (Versprechen) of a find that awaits appropriate seeking (das gemässe Suchen wartet) > to have premonition (vermuten) of this doesn’t require prophetic gifts but only attentiveness (Achtung), practiced for decades, to that announced (bekundet) in metaphysical thinking [Heidegger’s askesis]

content: recollective thinking (Andenken) has task of attending to this concealment, in which unconcealment is grounded [how do you know that, if its essence has not yet been revealed?] > recollect not what becomes past: but all enduring (allem Währen) that each case (je) of Ereignis of X Being grants (gewährt)
linkedContent: recollective thinking (Andenken) has task of attending to this concealment, in which unconcealment is grounded [how do you know that, if its essence has not yet been revealed?] > recollect not what becomes past: but all enduring (allem Währen) that each case (je) of Ereignis of X Being grants (gewährt)

content: recovery (Verwindung) of metaphysics is recovery of oblivion of Being, recovery turns (Verwindung wendet sich) toward essence of metaphysics > in order to respond to recovery must first clarify essence of metaphysics [not yet there? Destruction still required?] > “in this recovery, the enduring truth (bleibende Wahrheit) of metaphysics that has seemingly been rejected first returns explicitly (kehrt erst eigens zurück) as the now appropriated (angeeignetes) essence of metaphysics”
linkedContent: recovery (Verwindung) of metaphysics is recovery of oblivion of Being, recovery turns (Verwindung wendet sich) toward essence of metaphysics > in order to respond to recovery must first clarify essence of metaphysics [not yet there? Destruction still required?] > “in this recovery, the enduring truth (bleibende Wahrheit) of metaphysics that has seemingly been rejected first returns explicitly (kehrt erst eigens zurück) as the now appropriated (angeeignetes) essence of metaphysics”

content: every restoration (Restauration) is an interpretation of metaphysics [but recovery or metaphysics not a mere restoration?] > Heidegger on “Destruction,” not a demolishing (Zertrümmerung) of metaphysics, intended only to reattain originary experiences of Being belonging to metaphysics by deconstructing (Abbau) representations that have become commonplace/empty
linkedContent: every restoration (Restauration) is an interpretation of metaphysics [but recovery or metaphysics not a mere restoration?] > Heidegger on “Destruction,” not a demolishing (Zertrümmerung) of metaphysics, intended only to reattain originary experiences of Being belonging to metaphysics by deconstructing (Abbau) representations that have become commonplace/empty

content: when question “What is…?” concerned w/ discussing (erörtern) the surpassing (Überstieg) of beings by Being, this surpassing immediately calls into question elements distinguished from one another in that distinction (Unterscheidung) [beyond ontological difference], the distinction in which doctrine of metaphysics moves, or from which metaphysics receives basic outline (Grundriss) of its language (essence/existence, what-being/that-being)

content: question “What is metaphysics?” at first relies indiscriminately on distinction Being/being, but when it asks of Being’s surpassing of beings, becomes one of those questions that stabs itself in the heart, not so that thinking may thereby die, but live in transformed manner [living suicide] > ponder what is other than beings [Being as totally other?]

content: sciences believe representation of being exhausts entire realm of what can be researched, apart from beings there’s “nothing else” > metaphysics distinguished by science by the surpassing: Being of beings > for science, Being can only present itself as nothing > how do things stand w/ that which is totally other (ganz Anderen) than anything that is, that which is not a being (i.e. Being)? [Being not crossed out]

content: Dasein “held into (hineingehalten)” “this” nothing: humans hold free the site (Ort) for the totally other (ganz Anderen) than beings, so that w/in this openness something like coming to presence (An-Wesen) (Being) can be given > Der Mensch ist der Platzhalter des Nichts

content: nothing is not beings but nevertheless given: Being & nothing employ (verwendet) themselves one for the other in kinship (Verwandtschaft) whose essential fullness [why full?] we’ve scarcely heeded (kaum bedacht) [not yet there] > there is a giving (Es gibt) > Being no more “is” than nothing: Es gibt both [giving then beyond Being?]

content: why do beings have priority w/out us giving thought to “not” of beings > if metaphysics thinks Being of beings (transcendens, the surpassing) can it also think “not” of beings, that nothing that is equioriginally the Same as Being?

content: [clever] Heidegger, defending against accusation of his own nihilism, explains that aversion of thought is part of destiny of nihilism, essence of nihilism resides (beruhe) in oblivion of Being [does that mean essence of nihilism does not reside in Being?]

content: “attempt to cross the line” captivated in form of representation (in ein Vorstellen gebannt) belonging to dominion (Herrschaftsbereich) of oblivion of Being > subject to doubts, like every image > but these doubts (Zweifeln) can’t touch illuminative force of images, their originary/uncircumventable presence (ursprüngliche und unumgehbare Gegenwart)—shows how little experience we have in the saying of thinking (der Sage des Denkens), in essence of such saying

content: in nihilism, fail to heed (achten) what is meant by oblivion of concealment of X Being > turning into essence of nihilism (die Einkehr in sein Wesen): first step prior to leaving nihilism behind, this turning in has a direction of turning back (Rückkehr) [not there yet]
linkedContent: in nihilism, fail to heed (achten) what is meant by oblivion of concealment of X Being > turning into essence of nihilism (die Einkehr in sein Wesen): first step prior to leaving nihilism behind, this turning in has a direction of turning back (Rückkehr) [not there yet]

content: [Heidegger’s method as Destruction then building (for dwelling)?] build path (Weg) leads back to locality (Ortschaft) of recovery (Verwindung) of metaphysics to let us journey through what is destined in overcoming (Überwindung) nihilism [not there yet, narrative yet to come] > despite rejection of text for publication [annihilation of trace], he who learns must examine more originarily, w/ greater care, the saying of reflective thinking, might leave such saying in realm of mystery one day, as highest gift (höchstes Geschenk) & greatest danger [beyond Being, the worst, totally other, risk annihilation?]

content: all Saying [of Being, of overcoming nihilism] proceeds awkwardly: must pass through essential ambiguity (Mehrdeutigkeit) of word, turn of phrase > ambiguity of Saying resides (beruht) in a play, the richer it unfolds, remains all the more rigorously maintained in concealed rule (in einer verborgenen Regel gehalten bleibt) [secret] > supreme law of Saying: freedom that frees us for ever playful jointure (allspielende Gefüge) [why jointure?] of never resting transformation (nie ruhenden Verwandlung)

content: Nietzsche (every contemporary thinks/poetizes “for”/“against” him) heard a calling demanding humans to prepare for dominating the earth, not war but polemos that first lets gods, humans, freemen, slaves appear in their essence, leads to a critical encounter of X Being [compared to this encounter, world wars remain superficial (vordergründig)] > did he collapse (stürzte) or take his thinking as far as he was able to go? > this thinking no easier for us: must restrict itself to something precursory (Vorläufigeres): give careful thought to ancient/venerable words whose saying addresses (zuspricht) us to essential realm of nihilism & its recovery (Verwindung) [paleonym]

content: Heraclitus’ Fragment 72 names humans and their “departure from being (Abkommen vom Sein)” (cf. Being and Time), designates a fall upon/away/from beings (Verfall oder Ab-fall [an das Seinde]) > this fall belongs to Difference (Unterschied) btwn Being/beings, so that Fall of Man sets aside [obscures] this difference > for Heraclitus, the foreign depart from difference [not as antagonistically (feindlich) disposed toward foreign (Fremden) as Plato]

content: xynon means same as koinon? > for Heraclitus, xynienai: going together; koinon merely katholon, the universal, i.e. “what belongs equally to all despite differences” [a going together that’s not the universal common] > co-belonging of xynon is differing (verschieden) (to diapheromenon), this alone can bring together (zusammenbringen): no night alone, no day alone, co-belonging of day/night (their very being) [not dialectic?]

content: driving force of subject-object dichotomy: quest for absolute certainty (Gewissheit), interpreting truth as certainty > Descartes’ ego cogito, as upokeimenon, subjectum, fundamentum inconcussum, henceforth, nature only appears as Object for a Subject > prelude to this advent: Luther’s quest for certainty in faith, Galileo’s search for mathematical certainty of nature, all prepared by nominalist separation of words/things, Ockham’s formalism makes possible project (Entwurf) of mathematical key (Schlüssels) to world > grasp in one concept: unity of mathematical certainty & certainty of salvation

content: ontological difference (danger that it represents being as a being): 1) the difference btwn being/beings is ontological 2) difference btwn being/beings carries along ontology, renders it possible as fundamental discipline of metaphysics > tradition moves in 2nd difference of understanding, no metaphysics recognizes difference as difference in dimension it unfolds (entfaltet)

content: relation btwn ontology & difference of being/beings can’t be taken up by metaphysics [overcoming metaphysics] > can’t think the foundation (Begründung), only its consequence (Folge): horizon in which ontological difference treated can’t appear as explicit them of ontology [ontology & metaphysics are here linked]

content: “reflecting-on” requires determined horizon, horizon in which I reflect > we don’t reflect on the Absolute, the Absolute is to be reflected, can’t grasp matter in advance (voraus ergreife), no determinate anticipation (Vor-griff), no perspective to grasp Absolute, all perspective finite > Absolute must be reflected on basis of itself, reflect (mirror) itself for it, bring itself to appearance, such “mirroring” leads to conception of Reason as “speculative” [quite different for Leibniz, where human Reason is the mirror]

content: what sort of positing is that by which Absolute appears for consciousness? > in Greek, positing is thesis, apothēkē means same as apophansis, let matter stand here from itself, as it is, i.e. presences (anwest) > modern positing, however, is closest to Latin repraesentatio, the re- refers back to ego cogito, re- as “back to me,” thus that which stands becomes object (all this covered over by presumptions of idealism)

content: difficult to accomplish anew what Greeks did when they thought Being as an appearing outside concealment (phusis), still we ask: what occurs in fact of arising-into-alētheia? > the overabundance (Überfülle), the excess (Übermass) of what presences (Anwesende), thus why Thales can only look to the heavens, relation to this thrust of presence is thaumazein [wonder] [height & excess] > in extreme opposition, when astronauts landed on moon, moon as moon disappeared, only a calculable parameter (Rechnungsgrösse) for technological enterprise of humans

content: how does Platonic idea (eidos) correspond to what Greeks named presence, ousia, the most extreme excess? for Plato, to change, to alter oneself (sich ändern): abwesen (to absence)—idea as pure presence, never absencing, self-maintaining-making-present, presencing presence (anwesende Anwesenheit) as what’s there in excess, ontos on (Nietzsche had strong sense of this, Twilight of…)

content: Heidegger speaks of something inappropriate in formulation of “meaning of being,” possible to interpret “project” as a human performance, project only as structure of subjectivity (this is how Sartre reads it) > Heidegger countered this mistake w/ “truth of being,” still retaining meaning of project as opening disclosure (Erschliessung), and to assure that truth wasn’t confused w/ correctness, Heidegger explained it by “location (Ortschaft) of being,” which presupposes understanding of Ortseins des Ortes (place-being of place), hence Topologie des Seyns

content: Sein: Nichts: Selbes? > essence of metaphysics: nothing metaphysical [overcoming metaphysics] > Heidegger’s word neither on side of beings, nor simply on that of being: speaks from where horizon of difference (Differenz) becomes visible: ontological difference as condition of possibility (Bedingung der Möglichkeit) for metaphysics [differance] > Heideggerian proposition (Aussage): is difference itself, speaks of difference w/out holding onto it, thus he has abandoned (verlassen) metaphysics

content: nothing in Heidegger not negative, is a nihilating nothing (nichtendes Nichts), its essence turns away from beings: “nothing in its nihilation refers to the being in its manifestation (Offenbarkeit),” “the nihilation (Nichten) of the nothing “is” being” [cf. 58 nihilating nothing as forgetfulness, beings pressing into foreground?]

content: Heidegger’s question “Why are there beings/not nothing?” doesn’t seek 1st cause [like Leibniz? Schelling?], seeks to come out of forgetfulness of Being > his question authentically says: “how does it come about that you concern yourself so much w/ beings and so little w/ being?”

content: negative (Nichten) vs. denying (Verneinen): Greek distinction ouk and mē? > negating as Greek ouk, then nothing as total nothingness (nihil negativum): beings denied, there are no beings > negating via mē, certain defect re: being > but if being/nothing are same, nothing can’t signify a lack (Fehlen), negating not privative-negative, something other (etwas Anderes), completely specific/unique (ganz und gar Eigenes und Unvergleichliches)

content: nothing characterizes being: ontological proposition > when nothing & its negating aren’t understood negatively, being is something entirely other (etwas ganz und gar Anders) than a being > participle “nihilating (nichtend)” as determinate activity of being, durch die allein das Seiende ist > name it an origin if all ontic-causal overtones are excluded [possible?]: Ereignis of Being as condition for arrival (Ankunft) of beings: das Sein lasst das Seinde anwesen [factical life]

content: “Time and Being” thought “letting” as “giving (Geben)” > giving speaks in Es gibt (il y a too ontic of a translation, refers to presence of beings) > too ontic to understand Es Gibt as letting come to presence, as if it means “to make present” > rather think Es gibt re: letting itself, presence no longer emphasized: “to let the presencing (Lassen das Anwesen)” [still presence there?] (presence of a being no long draws one’s attention but ground the being covers over to stand independent) > letting as gift (Gabe), gives only its gift, withdraws/holds back (verbirgt)

content: when attention is drawn to the presencing (das Anwesen) of “letting-be,” this interpretation that of metaphysics [doesn’t Heidegger interpret as such in Anaximander?] > in emphasis (Betonung) on presencing, a 3rd has its place (Ort), the stress (Ton) now on letting itself, that which allows (lässt) (releases [entlässt]?) presencing, allows Being, the epochē of Being: one stands before being as being, not a form (Gestalten) of its destiny [so close to Hegel] > in emphasis to let presencing, no longer room for name Being, letting is pure giving, the it (das Es) that gives, Ereignis [beyond Being]

content: no destinal (geschickliche) epoch of Ereignis: sending is from enowning (Das Schicken ist aus dem Ereignen) > return to Greeks only has meaning as a return to Being [?] > “step back (Schritt züruck)” (step that retreats [züruckgeht] from metaphysics [overcoming metaphysics]) has sole meaning of enabling (ermöglichen) glance ahead (Vorausblick) to what comes (was kommt) [to-come], thinking begins anew: in essence of technology thought catches sight of heralding portent (verdeckenden Vor-Schein), die verbergende Vor-Erscheinung des Ereignisses selbst

content: as technology unfolds objectivity (Gegenständlichkeit) (as a manner of sending) transforms more into standing reservedness (Beständlichkeit) > no longer objects today only standing reserves (beings held in readiness for being consumed [Verbrauchtwerden]), no longer substances but subsistances > energy politics, politics of agriculture: systematic ordering of space w/in general planning, directed toward future exploitation (Ausbeutung), everything arranged in horizon of utility: orderability (Bestellbarkeit) [better than Beherrschung] of what is to be seized > for example: forest as “greenspace” (stock, supply, means)

content: ontological determination of standing reserve not permanence but orderability, persistent standing-at-one’s-disposal (zur-Verfügung-stehen)—for consumption in planning of whole > replaceability (Ersetzbarkeit) essential to way of being today, every being essentially replaceable [cf. Derrida on substitution], Ersetzbarsein > for example: fashion > time becomes current affairs (Aktualität), continual novelty of incessant change [obsession w/ new] [Heidegger wonders whether May ’68 realized all this]

content: to unfold question of meaning of Being, Being must be given > Husserl succeeded in this making present of Being, phenomenally present in category > Husserl gave Heidegger ground: “being” no mere concept, no pure abstraction > Husserl doesn’t inquire forth into Being after reaching Being as given, doesn’t ask what it means > no question for Husserl, “being” means being-object (but objectivity is a mode of presence)

content: subjectivity itself not questioned re: its being > since Descartes, subjectivity is fundamentum inconcussum, the barrier to unfolding Seinsfrage ——the “making-present-to-oneself (Selbstvergegenwärtigung)” of consciousness takes place in immanence, what I am conscious of is present to me, in my consciousness > in Being and Time, “thing” no longer in consciousness, but in the world > despite intentionality, Husserl remains trapped in immanence: Husserl retrieves proper consistency of object, saves object, but by situating it in immanence of consciousness

content: when Heidegger looks at inkwell, does so w/out reference to hyletic data and categories, he undergoes fundamental experience w/ thing itself [outside consciousness but still moral image of thought?] > “being” in Da-sein says being-outside-of [vs. being in of consciousness], must preserve an “outside,” thus ek-stasis > Dasein rigorously means: ek-statically being there (immanence is broken) > from ek-stasis to instancy in the clearing (Inständigkeit in der Lichtung) [the turn?]

content: Marxism as a whole rests on this thesis [from Early Writings]: “to be radical is to grasp the root of the matter, but for man the root is man himself,” thinks on the basis of production: social production of society, self-production of human being as social being > Marxism is thought of today, where self-production of man & society prevail [isn’t Nietzsche & Hegel also thought of today?] > self-production (Selbstherstellung) raises danger (Gefahr) of self-destruction (Selbstzerstörung)

content: can man bring about all these imperatives & could he break them himself? Marxism & sociology name the “imperatives”—to which we are compelled today > Heidegger gathers then in name Ge-stell, most extreme form of history of metaphysics, of the destiny of being, from epoch of objectivity to orderability, no longer objects only “consumer goods” at disposal of every consumer [w/out objectivity, is there no more consciousness?]

content: surrender consciousness, join new domain (Bereich) of Dasein, must step into it, enter it, to stand in relation to what isn’t man > entry into this domain not produced by thought undertaken by Heidegger: to believe thinking capable of changing place of man, still conceive it (vorstellen) on model of production (Produktion); rather, thinking prepares man for possibility (Möglichkeit) of corresponding to such an entry (Einkehr) [so attention is delayed!]

content: ontological determination of imperative (Zwang): Ge-stell > in Ge-, one hears gathering, unification, bringing together of all modes of positing (Stellens) > positing as a challenging (Herausfordern), nature is held to (Anhaltens zu) something, forced to adopt a certain form, to play a role > if nature is posed (gestellt) to deliver its energy, man is set (gestellt) to encounter/correspond to these produced energies: the greater the challenging of nature, greater challenge man imposes on himself

content: scholastic word objectum is translation of Greek word antikeimenon, but keisthai of antikeimenon means already lying before > whereas object, via representation, brought to halt in an “over and against (im Gegenüber)” > Greek experience of already lying before (and from itself) doesn’t require representation play role in positing being > Aristotle interprets phusis from poiēsis, bringing-forth into open—not modern notion of production (set into availability [Herstellen in die Verfügbarkeit])

content: Marx (like Feuerbach): “criticism of religion ends w/ teaching that man is the highest being for man” > Heidegger’s Marx interpretation not political, concerned w/ Being in manner it destines itself: w/ Marx, position of most extreme nihilism is reached [what about Nietzsche?] > if man is the highest being for man, Being (as Being) is nothing (nichts) (nihil) anymore for man > to understand Marx politically: make politics a mode of self-production (perfectly consistent w/ Marx’s thought) (Marx’s statement decidedly metaphysical)

content: in Greek manner, einai means to presence (Greeks speak more revealingly (zeigender)/precisely than we do) [Heidegger’s bias?] > Parmenides’ esti gar einai, genuine tautology: names Same only once, as itself: [fragment 8] “the same dwelling in the same, it lies in itself” [cf. 80 verse is eukuklos, abundant/overflowing, says on its own complete tautology] > in domain of inapparent (Unscheinbaren): presencing itself presences (anwest Anwesen selbst): “great number of indications (Zeignisse) [marks? traces?]…”, indication as sēma, what shows & lets be seen

content: the thinking here [Greek thought]: tautological thinking: primordial sense of phenomenology, prior to any distinction btwn theory/praxis > in philosophy there are only paths (Wege), in sciences only methods > to understand phenomenology: path that leads away to come before…, “lets that before which it is led show itself”: a phenomenology of the inapparent > now you can understand: there were no concepts for Greeks

content: things appearing in Gegnet no longer objects, no longer stand opposite us, no longer stand at all > they lie, “rest in the return to the aiding of the expanse of their self-belonging” > there can be rest where rest is the seat/reign of all movement > we can’t really describe what he have named > non, any description would reify it > but, it lets itself be named & thus we can think about it (not representationally) > perhaps we are close to being released into nature of thinking…through waiting for its nature [arrival?]

content: how movement comes from rest suddenly clearer to me > scientist causes great embarrassment, asking: “how far is it really Gelassenheit into which I tried to let myself?” > what we designate w/ a word doesn’t have that word hanging on it (like a name plate) > whatever we name has been nameless before > how can we decide the adequacy of a name? or is all designation arbitrary? > is there the nameless at all? or does the name not occur to us? > p. 71 perhaps names are not the result of designation but the occurring together of the nameable, name, & named (nature of words)

content: hints [traces?]: enigmatic (rätselhaft), Sie winken uns zu, Sie winken ab [hints hint toward us, hint away] > “they beckon ourselves toward that from which they unexpectedly (unversehens) [unforeseeably] bear themselves toward us” > hints & gestures not signs, chiffres (latter have there habitat in metaphysics) [cf. p. 27] > hints/gestures belong to totally other (ganz anderen) Wesensraum [realm of reality?]

content: [back to path of question of hermeneutics] hermeneutics als Beiwort to “phenomenology,” means the interpretation itself [not hermeneutics usual meaning] > explaining etymology of hermeneutics will help clarify Heidegger’s intention (Absicht) w/ experiment (Versuch) of phenomenology > Japaner points out Heidegger has now dropped both words [along his path] > not done to deny phenomenology, but to abandon (lassen) my path of thinking to namelessness > which can’t be successful > because public requires rubric (Titel)

content: explanation (Erläuterung) of hermeneutics may issue (versteht) in a discussion (Erörterung) [Trakl essay] > hermenuein to hermeneus to Hermes (playful thought more compelling than rigor of sense): divine messenger, brings message of destiny (Botschaft des Geschickes) > hermeneuein: explanation that brings tidings (Kunde), can listen to a message > Plato’s Ion: poets “are interpreters (hermenes) of gods” > hermeneutics not just interpretation but the bearing (das Bringen) of message/tidings

content: since Being and Time, bring out Being of beings (not in metaphysical manner [overcoming metaphysics]), so Being itself will shine out: the presence of present things (Anwesen des Anwesenden), two-fold of two in their simple oneness (Einfalt) > language: the prevailing (Vorwaltende) and bearing up (Tragende) in relation (Bezug) of human nature to two-fold > man realizes (west) [his nature] as man by corresponding (entspricht) to the call (Zuspruch) [promise?] of two-fold, bears witness (bekundet) to two-fold in its message (Botschaft)

content: language: fundamental trait (Grundzug) im hermeneutischen Bezug des Menschenwesens zur Zwiefalt von Anwesen und Anwesendem [in human nature’s relation to twofold of presence & present beings] > [we must] hear “Bezug” in this statement in a totally other way > not Bezug of demand (Brauchen) & supply (Beibringen) of commodities (Waren), man not a commodity > but man in his essence is in demand (gebraucht), this need claims him (beansprucht) > man is really man when “im Brauch (needed & used by…)” that which calls (ruft) him to preserve (verwahren) twofold

content: the call of two-fold can’t be explained by presence or present beings, nor in terms of their relation > only two-fold itself which unfolds (enfaltet) the clarity, the clearing (Lichtung), in which Anwesende als solches and Anwesen can be discerned (unterscheidbar) for man > no longer say relation to two-fold, not an object of mental representation, but: the sway of usage (das Walten des Brauches), which we never experience (erfahren) directly [!] [arrival?] if we think (vorstellen) two-fold as difference (Unterschied) visible in comparison that tries to hold Anwesende and Anwesen apart from each other

content: w/ first experience of phenomenon, Greeks didn’t press present beings into opposing objectness (Gegenständigkeit) > phainesthai: a being assumes its radiance (Scheinen), in which it appears (erscheinen) > Das Erscheinen (appearance) still Grundzug of Anwesen von Anwesende, as [beings] rise into unconcealment (Entbergung) ——Heidegger doesn’t think appearance in Greek or Kantian sense > but, what’s decisive (ankommt) [arrival?] is difficult, calls (verlangt) for simple/free vision (Blick)

content: Iki: breath of stillness of luminous delight (Entzückens) > delight: what ensnares (Entziehen), carries away (Hinzücken)—into stillness > delight is the same kind as the hint that beckons on, to and fro (des Fort- und Hin- und Her-winkens) > hint is message of the veiling that opens up (lichtenden Verhüllens) > so all presence (Anwesen) has its source in grace (Anmut): pure delight of the calling stillness (rufenden Stille)

content: is the dialogue from out of the nature of language? mustn’t it first enter into a hearing that at once (sogleich) reaches (einzulassen) essence of language? > Heidegger once called this strange relation hermeneutic circle, exists wherever relation of message & message-bearer prevails (waltet) > message-bearer must come from message, but also must have gone toward it [affirm man’s habit, attention to Being, etc.] > but Heidegger will abandon circle, talk of it is always superficial p. 52 reach a corresponding saying of language [rather than speak about hermeneutic circle]

content: site (Ort), [originally means] die Spitze des Speers (point of the spear) [Derrida repeatedly refers to this statement], gathers into itself, to the highest and most extreme (Äusserste), a gathering that penetrates (durchdringt)/pervades (durchwest) everything > a site gathers & preserves (verwahrt) what it gathers, not like an encapsulated shell (Kapsel), but by shining through, lighting up, and thus releasing (entlässt) what it gathers to its own nature

content: [Heidegger discusses the relation btwn clarification (Erläuterung) of poem and discussion (Erörterung)] to discuss must pass through clarification, any right clarification [another version of authenticity] presupposes discussion: thinking dialogue (denkende Zwiesprache) w/ Gedicht remains (verharrt) w/in reciprocity (Wechselbezug) btwn clarification/discussion > only poetic dialogue w/ Gedicht is true dialogue: poetic conversation (Gespräch) btwn poets

content: Geschlecht (kin, kind, generation): a human cast away (verschlagene) from Menschenwesen, stamped (geprägte) in one cast (einem Schlag) > Geschlecht: both mankind as a whole and kinship of race, tribe, family, all of these stamped in the duality of the sexes (Zwiefache der Geschlechter), decomposed form of man, man unsettled (entsetzte) > a curse (Fluch) has struck man [cf. Derrida on Geschlecht, 2nd blow of sexes] > not duality (Zwiefache) but discord (Zwietracht) is the curse

linkedContent: [p.172 who is the Abgeschiedene (the departed one)?] the dead one (Gestorbene) lives in his grave, the dead one is the madman (Wahnsinnige) > madness not as mental illness, he is of another mind, taken his way in another direction, his madness “gentle,” his mind pursues a greater stillness

content: in Trakl, “the boy’s blue voice retrieves (zurückholt) something forgotten and fore-tells (vorsagt) it” [cf. youth in Evening Conversations] [p. 178 earliness of long since dead promises “springtime of the soul”]> the boy? Elis, the stranger called to go under (Elis different from Trakl, like Zarathustra different from Nietzsche) > Elis goes down into uralte Frühe, older than decomposing Geschlecht, older because more mindful (sinnender), more mindful because more still, more still because self-stilling > boy Elis shelters/stores gentle two-fold of sex [sexual difference not in discord of duality]

content: Trakl: “And the unborn tends to its own peace” [cf. the dead bury their dead] > unborn guards (hütet)/watches over (wahrt) the stiller childhood, “for the coming awakening of mankind” > at rest, the early dead (Frühvestorbene) lives [the 2nd kind of “a dead”: the stranger, the departed, the unborn], promises the gentler two-fold of mankind [sexual difference no in discord of duality]

content: gold, truth, rightness > [death] earliness in which stranger has expired (verstorben), shelters the Wesensgerechte of the unborn > the end (Ende) not sequel (Folge) of beginning, its the end of decaying Geschlechtes, thus precedes (vorauf) beginning of unborn Geschlechtes: as earlier earliness, has already overtaken the end

content: true time (wahre Zeit), the arrival (Ankunft) of what has been (Gewesenen) > not the past, but gathering of Wesenden, which precedes all arrival: gathers itself into shelter of the earlier [before the given moment?] [no presence/arrival in true time?]

content: nocturnal silence (Schweigen der Nacht), silence itself w/ its night, belongs (gehört) to apartness (Abgeschiedenheit), die Dämmerung als das Tor zum Untergang [passage], the soul’s nocturnal wing-beat (der nächtliche Flügelschlag der Seele) > [the reign of this gathering in apartness unfolds w/out delay, nicht nachträglich] > the apartness is ghostly (geistlich) > [sister of stormy sadness]

content: ghostly (Geistliche) means spiritual, but not that of the church or priest, no ecclesiastical overtones for Trakl > he doesn’t use “of the spirit (Geistige),” since this would directly oppose material
linkedContent: ghostly (Geistliche) means spiritual, but not that of the church or priest, no ecclesiastical overtones for Trakl > he doesn’t use “of the spirit (Geistige),” since this would directly oppose material

content: via Trakl, apartness is spiritual/ghostly (geistlich), vom Geist bestimmt, but not “of the spirit (geistig)” (in metaphysical sense) > for Trakl, in “Grodek,” spirit is flaming, not pneuma (ethereal), but a flame that inflames, startles (aufjagt), horrifies (entsetzt), shatters us, the glowing lumination > flame is the ek-stasis (Ausser-sich), which lightens and calls forth radiance, but may go on consuming (weiterfressen) and reduce (verzehren) all to white ashes [cf. Derrida on absolute ash] > “Flame is the palest pallor’s brother” > Geist, for Trakl, as gheis (ghost), a being terrified (aufgebracht), beside himself (entsetzt), ek-static

content: Geist (ghost or spirit), via Trakl, possibility of both gentleness and destructiveness (Zerstörerischen) > Das Sanfte [gentleness] schlägt jenes Außer-sich des Entflammenden keineswegs nieder, sondern hält es in der Ruhe des Freundlichen versammelt [holds ek-stasis in peace of friendship] > Das Zerstörerische [destructiveness] kommt aus dem Zügellosen, das sich im eigenen Aufruhr verzehrt und so das Bösartige betreibt [consumes itself, unbridled evil] > evil is ghostly, the revolt (Aufruhr) of a terror blazing away in blindness, the ungathered, fragmented, unholy—threatens to turn gentleness to ash (des Sanften zu versengen droht) [cf. Derrida on absolute ash]

content: [spirit & soul] spirit drives soul in das Unterwegs, carries soul over to strangeness > soul is gifted (beschenkt) w/ the soul > spirit is the animator (Beseeler) [cf. p. 181 pain animates] > but soul guards the spirit, “feeds” it, no spirit w/out soul: soul invests spirit w/ flame (its very nature), the glow of melancholy (Schwermut), “the patience (Sanftmut) of the lonely (einsamen) soul”

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

linkedContent: [spirit & soul] spirit drives soul in das Unterwegs, carries soul over to strangeness > soul is gifted (beschenkt) w/ the soul > spirit is the animator (Beseeler) [cf. p. 181 pain animates] > but soul guards the spirit, “feeds” it, no spirit w/out soul: soul invests spirit w/ flame (its very nature), the glow of melancholy (Schwermut), “the patience (Sanftmut) of the lonely (einsamen) soul”

content: solitude (Einsame) carries soul toward the One (Einzigen), the burden (Schwere) of fate: carry the soul toward the spirit > soul’s melancholy glows when Soul in journey enters the widest width of its properness (ihres eigenen), which is wandering > soul’s greatness, achieve flaming vision (Anschauen), becomes at home (proper) in pain [pain as MOP?]: pain’s nature is in itself converse (gegenwendiges)
linkedContent: solitude (Einsame) carries soul toward the One (Einzigen), the burden (Schwere) of fate: carry the soul toward the spirit > soul’s melancholy glows when Soul in journey enters the widest width of its properness (ihres eigenen), which is wandering > soul’s greatness, achieve flaming vision (Anschauen), becomes at home (proper) in pain [pain as MOP?]: pain’s nature is in itself converse (gegenwendiges)

content: flaming pain tears away, its rending (Fortriss) consigns [marks?] (einzeichnet) wandering soul to conjunction (Fuge) of storm [heaven]/hunt [God] > would seem pain’s rending would overwhelm (überwältigen), rather than letting soul prevail (walten) in veiling radiance > but! [here is Heidegger’s refusal of differance], the beholding vision (Anschauen) can rejoin (fügt zurück) the flaming sweep (flammenden Fortriss) to the fitting submission (Fügsame) of seeing acceptance (schaunden Hinnehmens) [moral image of thought], der Rückriss im Schmerz, pain achieves its mildness, its power (Walten) to convey/disclose

[here is Heidegger’s refusal of differance], the beholding vision (Anschauen) can rejoin (fügt zurück) the flaming sweep (flammenden Fortriss) to the fitting submission (Fügsame) of seeing acceptance (schaunden Hinnehmens) [moral image of thought], der Rückriss im Schmerz, pain achieves its mildness, its power (Walten) to convey/disclose

content: spirit is flame, its shining occurs (geschieht) im Blick des Anschauens > Solchem Anschauen ereignet sich die Ankunft des Scheinenden, worin alles Wesende anwest [the accepting vision that tames pain enowns the arrival of all that shines, where all that is, is present] > nature of vision impenetrable to those who understand pain as sensitivity
linkedContent: spirit is flame, its shining occurs (geschieht) im Blick des Anschauens > Solchem Anschauen ereignet sich die Ankunft des Scheinenden, worin alles Wesende anwest [the accepting vision that tames pain enowns the arrival of all that shines, where all that is, is present] > nature of vision impenetrable to those who understand pain as sensitivity

content: soul: great giver of life > everything that is alive is painful > pain is the animator (Beseelende) [cf. 180 the soul is the animator] > only the soulful fulfills destiny, capable, gifted as such, of joining in harmony the mutual bearing (wechselweisen Sichtragens) by which all living things belong > relation of fitness (Bezug des Taugens), all that lives is fit, i.e. good: good is good painfully > only true in pain > because pain is converse, kann das Lebende sein Mitanwesendes in seiner jeweiligen Art verbergend entbergen [sheltering concealment], wahr-haft [preservation/truth] sein lassen [truth as letting beings truly be what they are]

content: “softly (leise)” always leads us softly to essential relations (wesenhaften Bezüge) > pain conceals itself in stone (petrifying pain) > silent glow of 1st dawn (earliest, ancient origin [uralte Herkunft]), the prior beginning coming toward everything that is becoming (Werdende), brings it to the never-to-be-obtained arrival [the never-arriving arrival] (nie einholbare Ankunft) of its essential being

content: pain is the favor/benignity (Gunst) in nature of all essential being > the onefold simplicity (Einfalt) of its converse (gegenwendigen) nature “determines (bestimmt) all becoming out of concealed primal earliness, and attunes (stimmt) it to the bright serenity of the great soul”

content: beneath the one semblance is concealed the Einfalt of pain, flaming the furthest when holds to itself most intimately [beholding vision] > pain as Grundzug of great soul, in pure harmony w/ holiness of blue: “blue shines upon the soul’s face by withdrawing into its own depth” > holy is present (west)/endures (währt) only by keeping w/in this withdrawal (in diesem Entzug verhält), turning vision toward fitting (Fügsame) [via flame of pain]

content: acc. Aristotle [classical architectonic (Baugefüge) structure of language], letters show sounds, sounds show passions of soul, passions of soul show matters that arouse them (be-treffenden Sachen) > showing (Zeigen) holds up this classical structure > relation btwn Showing and what it shows (Gezeigten) becomes conventional relation btwn sign (Zeichen) & its signification (Bezeichnetem) > transformation (Änderung) of sign from something that shows (Zeigenden) to something that designates (Bezeichnenden): a change in the nature of truth

content: Humboldt regards language as a world and world view (Weltansicht) > he doesn’t think language as language, but language as chief source of historical-spiritual development of man > language as a world view of a human subjectivity > Humboldt reads language as energeia, but thinks energeia in wholly un-Greek manner, via Leibniz’s monadology as activity of subject: language is turned in direction of man > Humboldt doesn’t consider the Sprachwesen (linguistic nature) of the nature of language (Wesen der Sprache): the being of language, that it abides (währt), remains gathered in what it grants itself

content: Sage: showing, pointing out, signaling (Jean Paul called phenomena of nature “spiritual pointer” or “spiritual index finger”) > Das Wesende der Sprach ist die Sage als die Zeige > in view of Gefüge der Sage, showing not exclusively/decisively property of human activity: Das Sichzeigen kennzeichnet als Erscheinen das An- und Abwesen des Anwesenden jeglicher Art und Stufe [presence still magnetizes presence/absence: self-showing marks the appearance of every kind/rank of presence/absence of all that is present] > even when man accomplishes showing, showing preceded by an indiction that it can be shown [beyond human] > must think of human saying like this to give adequate definition des Wesenden in all speaking

content: showing prevails in Saying, even in everything that waits for us unspoken > Saying not linguistic expression added to phenomenon: all radiant appearance/fading away grounded (beruht) in showing Saying > Saying pervades (durchwaltet)/structures (fügt) openness of clearing (das Freie der Lichtung) that every appearance must seek & every disappearance must leave behind, in which all present/absent being must show/say/announce itself > Saying: the gathering that joins all appearance (alles Scheinen fügende Versammlung), lets all that shows abide w/in itself, the in-itself manifold showing

content: where does the showing spring (rührt) from? slow down, enough to heed (achten) what stirs/quickens (regt) in the showing, and bears this quickness out
linkedContent: where does the showing spring (rührt) from? slow down, enough to heed (achten) what stirs/quickens (regt) in the showing, and bears this quickness out

content: [method of arrival, in the instant?] we need a plain, sudden, unforgettable thus forever new look (Blick) into something we don’t even try to know > the quick and stirring regsames Erregende) of Saying: earliest/most ancient at once, region of all places, first break of dawn for all that is present/absent, that which makes the cycle of day/night possible: Das Regende im Zeigen der Sage ist das Eignen ——Eignen (Owning) that moves Saying as Showing is Ereignis, yields (er-gibt) opening of the clearing, in which present beings can persist (anwähren) & absent beings can depart, while keeping (behalten) their persistence (Währen) in withdrawal (im Entzug) [cf. erasure of trace] > das Ereignende [what is yielding] ist das Ereignis selbst—nothing else > Ereignis can’t be represented as occurrence (Vorkommnis) or happening (Geschehen), “can only be experienced as abiding gift yielded (Gewährende) by saying” > Ereignis is not the result of something, but the giving yield (Er-gebnis), whose giving along gives us Es gibt, to which even Being needs to come [so to come] into its own as presence (um als Anwesen in sein Eigenes zu gelangen)

content: thinking must stop thinking we are thinking of “Being” as appropriation, Ereignis is richer than any conceivable definition of Being > Being, however, can be thought of, re: its origin, in terms of Ereignis [beyond Being]

content: way: to bring way forth, to be the way > Ereignis appropriates man to its own usage (Brauch) > Ereignis is the way-making for Saying to come into language > way-making (Be-wëgung) puts essence of language as language (Sage) into language > the way to language has transformed along the way [when we attend], via human activity, shifted to appropriating nature of language > only appears as a shift (Verlagerung) to us, w/ re: to ourselves > [Heidegger adds Gelassenheit as term to describe us listening freely to this appropriating nature of language]

content: Saying has already overtaken (überholt) destructiveness of information-language because Appropriation can’t be commandeered (Unbestellbaren des Ereignisses)? > all true language (eigentliche Sprache), because sent/assigned/destined (geschickt) by way-making of Saying, is in the nature of destiny (dadurch geschicklich) > no natural language of human w/out destiny, all language is historical > information-language too is historical, in sense of limits of present era > this era begins nothing new, only carries the old aspects of modern age to the extreme

content: if to know means to see something in wholeness of its nature, we can’t see the nature of language as such, in the round, because we belong w/in Saying, can only say something by saying it after Saying > language is monologue [cf. MONL], has its structure in the Aufriss of Saying: 1) language alone speaks authentically 2) language speaks lonesomely (einsam) > the some in lonesome, the same, Greek hama, Gothic sama, thus lonesome: “same in what unites that which belongs together” > Saying is in need of being voiced in word [Being needs man] > man’s needed usage (Brauchen), his resaying (Nachsagen) of what he listens to, lies in that lack (Fehlen) that isn’t negative or defective

content: deliberately speaking of annihilation (Vernichtung), not just destruction (Zerstörung): annihilation is the more encompassing (umfassendere) destruction (also takes into account destruction of countless lives) > can only speak of annihilation by intimations (Andeutungen), point away from what is not meant > annihilation not the highest grade of destruction but essentially other (wesenhaft anderes) than destruction > always something left over w/ destruction, no “remainderless (restlose)” destruction > there is no annihilation at all: the destruction where nothing left remaining, this remainder (Übrig) is nothing: has consumed (aufgezehrt) every “is” & itself > from destruction to annihilation, a change of condition, leap into another essence > not only nothing still left remaining in annihilation, but something, and only, of its own arises (entsteht)

content: referring to evil I see better how we can encounter devastation, that we cannot encounter devastation > must think devastation more rigorously > since devastation is not moral badness (Schlechtigkeit), moral indignation (moralische Entrüstung), even if it makes general public (Weltöffentlichkeit) its mouthpiece, can’t do anything against devastation > moral superiority (Überlegenheit) in no position to grasp, much less abolish (aufzuheben)/mitigate evil

content: Nietzsche interpreted morality, the Platonic-Christian ethical doctrine, & its later secularized forms (rational Ethics of Enlightenment/socialism), as appearances (Erscheinungen) of will to power > Nietzsche didn’t realize that a will to power “beyond good & evil,” as realm of pure will to power, remains only counter-world (Gegenwelt) to Platonism > Nietzsche’s doctrine of “discipline and breeding (Zucht und Züchtung)” is extreme affirmation of morality > if will is evil, will to power is least of all beyond evil

content: that which suffocates (Erstickende) does so hiding behind something insidious (Verfänglichen), that which announces (kundgibt) itself as one of man’s highest ideals: progress (Fortschritt), unrestrained achievement in all areas of creating, equal employment opportunities, & (the highest rationale) uniform welfare for all workers > what is really devastating is the way man obsesses with these goals (Ziele), devotes everything to their realization, driving on devastation (reinforcing its own consequences) [almost Freudian death drive logic]

content: in waiting we let things into where we ourselves belong, in rest (i.e. in return to themselves) > things, once returning as such, bring their own presence (Gegenwart) from themselves toward (entgegen) us, they fill out the emptiness that seems to gape around us as we wait > by not waiting on this restful repose, by hastening toward progress, humans become pacesetter (Schrittmacher) of devastation

content: if we were not already in essence those who wait, we could never become so [attention to Being] > we are only what we seek > seek only that on which we wait > wait on that in which we belong > we belong to the coming as the Gegenwart (present-waiting-toward) > as Gegenwart we release (lassen) ourselves to the coming, and in so releasing we 1st come into our own (eigen) > all these sentences say the selfsame > none can be preconceived, each thinks ahead (vordenkt) into the coming

content: those among a people (Volk) [Germans?] who poetize/think, wait in most noble manner: durch deren Gegenwart [through the present-waiting of the poet] zum Kommen das Wort in die Antwort des Menschenwesens gelangt und also in die Sprache gebracht wird > poets/thinkers wait on the arrival of this essence of theirs [devastation already passed over?], waiting people endangered like no other [rare], endangered not from outside threats but by tyranny of ignorant impatience, continual mistakes > Während dieses voreilige Scheinwesen [rash pseudo-essence] doch nur die ewig unbeholfene Nachahmung des Fremden bleibt [bad imitation of the foreign, Larry] > the people (Volk) who know its essence, can’t insist on it as a special calling (besondere Berufung)/distinction (Auszeichnung) > waiting people entirely unusable (unbrauchbar) to others, what waits yields nothing to be used (Nutzen) for progress > any fame of these people must be squander its essence purely on the unnecessary

content: [Heidegger on modern forms of ontology vis phenomenology] only through phenomenology that ontology corresponding to it established on secure basis (sichere Problembasis): only in this manner that the consciousness-of-, the “of which (Wovon),” the object character of a being (der Gegenstandscharakter des Seienden) as such, becomes visible (sichtbar) > wide sense of phenomenology includes ontology > but, in such ontology, meaning of being (Seinssinn) never posed, unknown to it, genesis of meaning remains closed off to it > which field of Being is never asked

content: “Facticity (Faktizität),” designation (Bezeichnung) for the Seinscharakter of “our” “own” Dasein: “this” Dasein in its Jeweiligkeit, Verweilen [see TN endnote p. 102 for extensive explanation of neologism here], “its being-there for awhile at the particular time,” insofar as it is “there” in the manner of be-ing > Dasein is there for itself in the how (Wie) of its ownmost being (seines eigensten Seins) > “Being—transitive: to be factical life!” > Being not the possible object of a having (Habens) [dispossession]

content: [history of the concept of “Man”] 1) living being endowed w/ reason (via Aristotle) 2) person or personhood (Christian explication guided by Revelation in Old Testament) > but logos never meant “reason” for Aristotle, but discourse (Rede), conversation (Gespräch): man as a being that has its world in mode (Weise) of something addressed (der Angesprochenen) [man in language]

content: [existential analytic defines the how of Dasein’s being] [re: temporality of today?] Dasein has its open space of publicness (Öffentlichkeit) and its ways of Seeing (seine Sicht) [there] [cf. 38 summary of today] > moves in definite mode of discourse (Redens) about itself: Gerede (talk) preserves Dasein in averageness > in talk lies guiding “as what” by which Dasein addresses “itself” > talk as the how in which Dasein’s having-been-interpreted (Ausgelegtheit) stands at its disposal > not externally applied to Dasein, something from out of which it lives, is lived, a how of is being

content: [re: historical human sciences] [a pre-critique of Foucault?] each culture interrogated re: expressive being of its formation (Ausdruckseins ihrer Gebilde), on basis of its style, bringing into relief (Abhebung) the Gestaltcharaktere des Gestalthaften: morphology > one culture must be held up against another, method of universally comparing forms (Gestaltvergleichung) (homology, analogy, synchronism, parallelism) > “a closed form-endowed context (Zusammenhang) of forms”: totality of historical past explicated in such a way, a flattening down (Niederschlag) [translator frustratingly prefers word condensation here], can be mastered at a glance (in einem Blick), can order via charts/rubrics [classifying (Ordnung)]

content: [phenomenology beyond dialectic] dialectic directionless (richtungslos) when no Grundblick in direction of (auf) the subject matter (Sache), a rationality testing/proving itself by looking this way (i.e. not dialectically) [Heidegger uses rationality affirmatively here?] > all dialectic lives from table of others, Hegel: “this traditional material” (Plato, Aristotle) “extremely importance source, indeed a necessary condition [and] presupposition to be gratefully acknowledged” (Science of Logic) > dialectic is double-sidedly un-radical: 1) lives from hand to mouth 2) eloquent about readymade material

linkedContent: phenomenology can only be appropriated (zugeeignet) phenomenologically, i.e. through demonstration (Ausweisung), & not by repeating Grundsätze or following Schuldogmen > we’re constantly deceived about things in themselves: once the conscience of philosophy, “now a pimp (Zuhälterin) for the public whoring of the mind (öffentlichen Hurerei des Geistes), fornicatio spiritus” (Luther)

content: dialectic must sideline itself re: fundamental task (i.e. work out question of object & how to decide it) > dialectic can’t stay w/ object & allow object to prescribe (vorgeben) “right mode of grasping it and the limits to this”

content: Dasein: not an object, when, as a distinctive being, it’s there for itself authentically

content: [method warning re: phenomenology] not about obtaining/delivering propositions/dogmas re: Dasein, generating a philosophy around it > rather, a special investigation w/ view to right direction of looking toward genuine phenomenon

content: two modes of Dasein of today (Dasein im Heute) (discourse about Dasein) [initial givens of today, closest to us? (Zunächst des Heute)] (: 1) historical consciousness 2) philosophy > modes of interpreting, modes of Dasein’s having-itself in a definite manner, must interrogate these modes to interrogate Dasein of today, to subject the today to a destruction > genuine question of hermeneutics: what Seinscharakter of Dasein shows up (zeigt sich) [cf. Sage as showing] in these modes of having-itself (Sichselbstshabens)?

linkedContent: [method] to discover the as what encountered via todayness of historical consciousness & philosophy, we follow a path of analysis “in which we look to their particular modes of being-related (Weise des Bezogenseins) to their object”

content: object of the past (Vergangenheit), in historical consciousness, stands in fundamental definition (Grundbestimmung): Ausdrucksein eines etwas von etwas > the past’s being subjected to a known definition, temporally particular styles > Vor-sicht (fore-sight) [not forehaving?] having the style in view
linkedContent: object of the past (Vergangenheit), in historical consciousness, stands in fundamental definition (Grundbestimmung): Ausdrucksein eines etwas von etwas > the past’s being subjected to a known definition, temporally particular styles > Vor-sicht (fore-sight) [not forehaving?] having the style in view

content: expressive network of reference to different cultural systems demands possibility of holding onto them in a unified manner (einer einheitlichen Behaltbarkeit) > thus, investigations are actualizing (vollzieht) themselves out of a foresight re: and of a having-in-view of styles (Vorsicht auf- und einem Im-Blick-haben des Stils) > w/in this point of view (Hinblick) the modes of expressive being are actualized > the anticipatory having-present of the cultural object, running in advance of all research, made explicit in its actualization: das Vorweghaben der Stileinheitlichkeit (the anticipatory forehaving or path-having in advance of unity of style) proves/guards (bewährt) its adequacy to subject matter while explaining itself (its basic characteristics still hidden) [self-fulfilling w/out an eye to destruction]
linkedContent: expressive network of reference to different cultural systems demands possibility of holding onto them in a unified manner (einer einheitlichen Behaltbarkeit) > thus, investigations are actualizing (vollzieht) themselves out of a foresight re: and of a having-in-view of styles (Vorsicht auf- und einem Im-Blick-haben des Stils) > w/in this point of view (Hinblick) the modes of expressive being are actualized > the anticipatory having-present of the cultural object, running in advance of all research, made explicit in its actualization: das Vorweghaben der Stileinheitlichkeit (the anticipatory forehaving or path-having in advance of unity of style) proves/guards (bewährt) its adequacy to subject matter while explaining itself (its basic characteristics still hidden) [self-fulfilling w/out an eye to destruction]

content: “tarrying among (Verweilen bei)” sustains possibility of actualizing a universal classifying that compares [historical] forms, in it lies relational guarantee that every past culture can be encountered objectively > a constant seeing this & that, can never halt [cf. 45 abode-less tarrying (das aufenthaltslose Verweilen) that holds itself/sojourns in (Aufhalten) what it returns to) > what’s encountered in this Verweilen as universal possibility of expression, divided into unities of style: beings in the How of their having-being, already there [for us to see] (i.e. past is available, is a past present, not our virtuality) > a pull (Zug) arises from the already there (schon da) in the past: world, life, publicness, what was going on [if destruction occurs by thinking Zug outside of Zug of historical consciousness, deconstruction occurs by noting that Zug of historical consciousness never occurs, i.e that everyday facticity has been overdetermined, we were never that close to it]

linkedContent: [cf. OPEN in Derrida] historical consciousness is “there,” brings itself into open publicity (Öffentlichkeit) w/ a definite self-interpretation (bestimmten Selbstauslegung)

content: historical consciousness gives itself task of overviewing “total fact of man (die ganze Tatsache Mensch),” bringing Dasein into view absolutely objectively > in this approach to past, the present of Dasein (Gegenwart des Daseins) is before itself in equally objective manner, & so is the future (not yet [Noch-nicht], just the present when calculated, anticipated by way of comparison): Spengler’s “decline of the West” not cheap witticism or whim, but consequential expression of historical consciousness: its inauthenticity thought through to the end [i.e. if we think of everything in this reductive way, then we have reduced our future]

linkedContent: attention (aufmerksam) should’ve been called to certain difficulty: many directions of philosophy today don’t provide much basis for phenomenological analysis Heidegger is initiating here

content: Heidegger believes it is best [why?] to treat everything said in today’s philosophy as pure/incontrovertible truth, not interested in truth/falsity of proposition but what goes on in this philosophy before it becomes what it is (was in dieser Philosophie vor sich geht) [hermeneutics as prior to philosophy] > methodology/logic couldn’t produce proper explanation because it would be a theory in same sense as this philosophy itself > Heidegger’s analysis will reactivate (nachvollziehen) step by step the context of its actualization (Vollzugszusammenhang) [cf. Derrida], bringing into relief how the object stands in view, how it is questioned, looked at, how concepts are being drawn (geschöpft) from it: ein Anspruch ganz primitiver Art (a quite primitive kind of claim/demand): can’t supply a basis (Boden) for this analysis

Derrida], bringing into relief how the object stands in view, how it is questioned, looked at, how concepts are being drawn (geschöpft) from it: ein Anspruch ganz primitiver Art (a quite primitive kind of claim/demand): can’t supply a basis (Boden) for this analysis

content: philosophy as universal classification (Ordnen), encompasses (umspannt) totality of culture (Gesamtheit der Kultur), the system of cultural systems > this totality not examined as theme in philosophy > temporal itself not investigated, but rather is that from out of which (von dem aus) classifying takes its point of departure (das Ordnen seinen Ausgang nimmt), so to insert it into context of classification > the comporting at point of departure (Ausgangsverhalten) of classifying grasps temporal in advance as types, essential generalities, only in this way can it enter a context of classification, so it doesn’t define or tarry in transitional stage, the one relevant for its actualizing > no one is disturbed by this, they characterize the point of departure as an object (temporal, empirical, mutable, subjective, real, singular, individual), in contrast to trans-temporal, ideal, universal

linkedContent: philosophy as universal classification (Ordnen), encompasses (umspannt) totality of culture (Gesamtheit der Kultur), the system of cultural systems > this totality not examined as theme in philosophy > temporal itself not investigated, but rather is that from out of which (von dem aus) classifying takes its point of departure (das Ordnen seinen Ausgang nimmt), so to insert it into context of classification > the comporting at point of departure (Ausgangsverhalten) of classifying grasps temporal in advance as types, essential generalities, only in this way can it enter a context of classification, so it doesn’t define or tarry in transitional stage, the one relevant for its actualizing > no one is disturbed by this, they characterize the point of departure as an object (temporal, empirical, mutable, subjective, real, singular, individual), in contrast to trans-temporal, ideal, universal

content: categories are haphazardly employed (from disparate sources) to characterize the basis (Boden) from out of which classifying begins to run its course (seinen Gang nimmt) > “that the Ausgangsverhalten is unworried (Unbekümmertheit) [since worry is there in opening to phenomenological hermeneutics] about its own concrete and precise clarification when the classifying and filing away is being done” “is only a symptom of the fact that its objects are ‘only’ material for a typology and system of classification” > idea of knowledge pursued (angestrebte) here, already sketched out in advance (schon vorgezeichnet) [goes on to describe static system, structuralism even]

content: developing (Ausbilden) of context of classificatory order is the leading self-conditioning mode of philosophy [the other 2: 1) the Ausgangsverhalten 2) accommodating multiplicity of types], analogous to holding-in-view of style in historical consciousness > this leading mode not a mere depicting, but a creative developing (schöpferisches Ausbilden) of the order itself: fashions (bildet) for/out of itself possibility of a universal process

content: relation of definitions of classificatory order: not one and then the other, but one is defined as that which belongs to the other [hetero-tautology], in itself it is the other as well, all others: (Welche Vorhabe? die des Wegsehens!) > the as-well-as (Sowohl-als auch), fundamental formal/categorial structure, limitlessness of its universality [bad infinity?]

content: being everywhere & nowhere of philosophical knowing: an absolute curiosity (Neugier) [Heidegger then describes something close to idle talk, how philosophy is public, has an autonomous curiosity, gives itself a foothold in life, thus preserving itself]

linkedContent: being everywhere & nowhere of philosophical knowing: an absolute curiosity (Neugier) [Heidegger then describes something close to idle talk, how philosophy is public, has an autonomous curiosity, gives itself a foothold in life, thus preserving itself]

content: objective scientific type of philosophy: proper refuge (Schutzwehr) in which Dasein protected from abysmal (bodenlosen) relativism, finds a secure foothold, brings objective possibility of more objective agreement (Übereinstimmung), “All of us…”, i.e. presents Dasein w/ tranquil certainty/security (ruhige Sicherheit) of general/unanimous “yes, I agree” [a force against snarl of worldviews, & rampant skepticism of our day] > when the system is dynamic has character of life itself, simultaneously universal & concrete [not subjective]

linkedContent: [Hegel as objective scientific philosophy] “Spirit” now lives in abode (Ort) of its self-certainty, no more goals, feelings, interests: “life has retired (zurückgezogen) into its authentic freedom”

content: [method: Heidegger now tries to show what is there for Dasein in the 2 interpretative modes (philosophy, historical consciousness)] Dasein itself goes toward something, having itself objectively there for itself, bringing itself objectively into its there > historical consciousness & philosophy are modes of Dasein, paths held open (preserved in itself), paths of securing/making certain, paths of falling away > Dasein encounters itself free of standpoints in objective certainty: 1) historical consciousness, Dasein encounters wealth of objective being of its having-been (Gewesenseins) 2) philosophy, Dasein encounters immutability of its always-being-in-such-a-manner (Immersoseins) > both interpretations bring Dasein before its highest & pure present

content: [bracketing of phenomenology—deconstruction of Heidegger’s destruction?] Husserl’s phenomenology: “where are the objects about which logic speaks and how are they for it?” > Brentano characterized consciousness as intentionality, a concept that arose in Middle Ages, though it had narrower meaning then: volitional being-out-for-something and going-toward-it (das willentliche Aussein auf etwas) (orexis)

content: epistemology still doesn’t understand that all theories of judgment are im Grunde theories of presentation (Vorstellungstheorie)
linkedContent: epistemology still doesn’t understand that all theories of judgment are im Grunde theories of presentation (Vorstellungstheorie)

content: Husserl’s object didn’t change, but the how of interrogating/defining it did, question of access (Zugangsfrage): a descriptive method (not a constructivist one) > “phenomenon” not primarily a category, but deals w/ how of access/grasping/safekeeping (Verwahrung), phenomenology (initially) nothing more than mode of research/inquiry (Weise der Forschung): “addressing (Ansprechen) something just as it shows (zeigt) itself and only to the extent that it shows itself”

content: [but] Husserl also held ideal of science, found it prescribed in mathematics: attempted to elevate description to mathematical rigor > mathematics is least rigorous of disciplines: easiest to gain access to [?]
linkedContent: [but] Husserl also held ideal of science, found it prescribed in mathematics: attempted to elevate description to mathematical rigor > mathematics is least rigorous of disciplines: easiest to gain access to [?]

content: to bring mathematics to play as model (Vorbildes) for all scientific disciplines is unphenomenological: meaning of rigor must be drawn from kind of object being questioned & mode of access appropriate to it (angemessenen Zugangsart) [Heidegger beyond Husserl]

linkedContent: Heidegger describes how transcendental idealism entered phenomenology [via Dilthey?] &, as a countermovement, traditional realism > no one asked whether epistemological questions are meaningless in phenomenology

content: [on the wishy-washy industry of phenomenology] George circle, Keyserling, anthroposophy, Stein, Phenomenology of Mysticism—“Beware of all this!” > “the ruin can no longer be halted!”
linkedContent: [on the wishy-washy industry of phenomenology] George circle, Keyserling, anthroposophy, Stein, Phenomenology of Mysticism—“Beware of all this!” > “the ruin can no longer be halted!”

content: phenomenology needs to be understood in accord w/ its possibility, possibility means: taking it up (ergreifen) in its being & developing (ausbilden) it (what’s sketched out in advance [vorgezeichnet] re: its possibilities)> in phenomenology, objects encountered by a definite manner of looking toward them and seeing them (bestimmtes Hinsehen), one does so already oriented toward them, an already-being-familiar (schon Bekanntsein), the sedimented result (Niederschlag) of having heard about them

content: [why phenomenology requires destruction] in any discipline, we’re face to face w/ how things stand at the moment [i.e. how the public world views them] > their showing-themselves (Sich-zeigen) can be so restricted/fixed (festgelegt) by tradition, the inauthenticity goes unnoticed, taken for authentic: one passes off a contingency (Zufälligkeit) as an in-itself, takes a covering up (Verdeckung) for Sache itself > need to get beyond position started from (Anfangsstellung) & arrive at grasp of subject matter free of covering up (zur verdeckungsfreien Sacherfassung zu kommen) > the tradition must be dismantled (abgebaut)

content: (formal indication) forehaving of Dasein = being-there of Dasein (factical life) is being in a world > the success of such a demonstration (Ausweisung) doesn’t say anything primordial about forehaving, is only a phenomenon of another forehaving lying further back (already at work in our descriptions) [infinite regress of forehaving, no arrival?] [but Heidegger stresses this being in a world only a formal indication, we must follow its indefiniteness to the right path of looking (rechte Blickbahn), by way of intuition?]

content: subject-object schema a constructivistic forehaving, almost ineradicable due to pertinacity (Hartnäckigkeit) of sedimented (verhärteten) tradition > Heidegger speaks of disastrous infiltration (Einbruch) [betrayal] of subject-object schema into phenomenological research

content: [prejudice of freedom from standpoints (Standpunktfreiheit)] elevates uncritical approach into 1st principle, promulgating fundamental blindness: “it cultivates a strange modesty and grants a general dispensation from critical questioning by means of the apparent self-evidence of what it demands”

content: free of standpoints only when there’s nothing to be done—but what if we have to look at things/research them? > free-standing detached standpoint = ruin of being-a-subject [is that now affirmative?] > developing our standpoint prior on the level of being > even unbiased seeing is a seeing, has a position in distinctive manner (appropriated so that it’s critically purged [kritischgereinigten]) > [so that an affirmative “freedom of standpoints” would be] an explicit (ausdrückliche) appropriation of our position of looking (Aneignung des Blickstandes), a position that is historical, not a chimerical in-itself outside of time

content: difficulty of untangling context of tightly woven categories, & demonstrating it in intuition, disappears if (always anew) we “hold to the task of appropriating (aneignet) the corresponding position of looking (entsprechenden Blickstand) at it and holding out in (durchält) this looking […] i.e., staying clear of a certain sedimented customary approach” [guard against (auf der Hut ist) slipping back into it unawares (unversehens)—is Heidegger always this vigilant? is attention given to destruction or to Being?]

content: as-what and How of the being-encountered (Begegnens) of what is close to us/given: significance > significant: being, being-there, in How of definite signifying/pointing (bestimmten Be-deutens) > wherein such definiteness consists, How a Dasein announces itself (sich bekundet), needs to be brought out from the concrete [?] > definiteness as disclosedness (Erschlossenheit): 1) availability in advance (Vorhandenheit) 2) advance appearance of a with-world (in dem mitweltlichen Vor-schein)

content: Besorgenswege [ways of care]: the beings-which-are-there don’t stand w/in definiteness of definitions, but w/in everydayness & its historicity (Geschichtlichkeit); the there in advance (vorhandene Da) brings the appearance (Vorschein) of “others” into its Dasein > what one-self pursues, that wherein one tarries for a while, one-self (man-selbst) “is” this world: everydayness of Dasein has its Dasein there for itself, seeking it by heeding what others say about it: possibilities of familiarity (of everyday) are factically historical [Mitsein]

content: something that is there for us in the being-there of everdayness has forfeited (eingebüsst) authentic character of its there, now lingers in indifference of something we can ascertain > this ascertainability (Festsellbarkeit): not its being, but possibility of its being-an-object > in contrast: disclosedness of what has significance shows the something there in How of its Dasein [Heidegger follows this w/ condensed summary, beginning w/ “From out of…”]

content: significance can only be understood on basis of disclosedness found w/in it, from out of which what is being encountered signifies itself, a pressing forth into its there within other things

content: only on basis (Grunde) of familiarity (Vertrautheit) [everydayness] can the “strange (Fremdes)” come forth > this lack of familiarity belongs to world being encountered, a heightened (gesteigertes) “there,” its inconvenience lies right w/in inexplicit (unabgehobenen) self-evidence of the familiarity of the there of everyday world > lack of familiarity belongs to world’s being-encountered, that’s why disturbed familiarity [contingent “otherwise than one thought”] has sense of being there > strange is there in its unpredictability/incalculability (Unberechenbarkeit)

content: to understand phenomenal context of significance: must see that its disclosedness stands in respective kind of care that tarries for awhile at a particular time (die Erschlossenheit in der jeweiligen Sorge steht): der Verweisungszusammenhang selbst ist das Besorgte > context of references is the environs in the authentic sense (eigentlich Umhafte), caring as a going around (Umgehen), going-here-and-there [cf. TEXT in Derrida] > significance (ontologically defined): the with-which of dealings (Umgang) with which our being cares

content: authentic mode of being in world is caring, meaning: producing, putting in place, directing ourselves to tasks, taking into possession, preventing, protecting against loss, etc. > in caring, life approaches/addresses itself (anspricht sich) in a worldly man > caring always concerned about itself [auto-affection?]: not a reflexivity of caring back upon itself, no, caring meets up w/ itself in a worldy manner in the there it is encountering [from implicit to explicit] > to be in the how of such caring: Besorgnis (anxious concern and its apprehensions)

content: character of being of care: absorbed (aufgeht) in its temporalization/actualization (Vollzug) > going about everyday dealings has character of carefreeness (Sorglosigkeit), world appears straightforward, self-evident, care is asleep: possibility remains that distress (Bedrängnis) will break forth in world > [Heidegger now racing to explain how curiosity (cura-curiositas!) doesn’t do away w/ self-evidence but reinforces it, thus care of curiosity covers itself up] > phenomenon of care, a fundamental phenomenon > (“I must break off here”)
